title: Real Life Applications with Venn Diagrams
body: A person with type O blood and a negative Rh factor $$(Rh-)$$ can donate blood to any person with any blood type. Four percent of African Americans have type O blood and a negative RH factor, $$5-10\%$$ of African Americans have the Rh- factor, and 51% have type O blood. The "O" circle represents the African Americans with type O blood. The "Rh-" oval represents the African Americans with the Rh- factor. We will take the average of 5% and 10% and use $$7.5\%$$ as the percent of African Americans who have the Rh- factor. Let O $$=$$ African American with type O blood and R $$=$$ African American with Rh- factor.\n##figure1.gif
